column1: * '''?''' - [[Christopher Tolkien]] is sent to [[Orange Free State
column2: South Africa]] for training in the Royal Air Force.
13]]''' - [[John Tolkien]] is made an Exorcist and Acolyte in a ceremony at Stonyhust.
18]]''' - [[Anthony Jackson]], the Tale Bearer in the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)
column3: 1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit'']], is born in [[Birmingham]], [[England]].

column2: 4]]''' - While writing on ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] sees a new charater arrive on the scene. He later [[Letter 66
column3: comments]]: ''"(I am sure I did not invent him, I did not even want him, though I like him, but there he came walking into the woods of [[Ithilien]]): [[Faramir]], brother of [[Boromir]]"''.

column2: 5]]''' - [[John Rhys-Davies]], who would play [[Gimli]] and voice [[Treebeard]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)
column3: ''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], is born.

column2: 19]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] writes [[Letter to G.E. Selby (19 September 1944)
12]]''' – [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] sends ''[[Leaf by Niggle]]'' to the ''Dublin Review'', which hosts a short-story competition. It was published in the January [[1945]] issue.
24]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] receives a letter from 12 year old John Barrow from [[wikipedia:Westtown Township, Pennsylvania
column3: West town, Pa.]]. The boy has already read ''[[The Hobbit]]'' eleven times, and his use of the term "Gee Whiz" delights Tolkien.

column1: * '''?''' - [[Gene Hargrove]], author and composer, is born.

column2: 17]]''' - [[Bernard Hill]], who would play [[Théoden]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)
column3: ''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], is born.
